info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on OpenId Connect Provider entity associated with your Azure API Management deployment. API Management allows you to access APIs secured with token from [OpenID Connect Provider ](http://openid.net/connect/) to be accessed from the Developer Console.

get.description: Lists of all the OpenId Connect Providers.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| displayName | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Lists of all the OpenId Connect Providers.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: opid
parameters.description: Identifier of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The response body contains the specified OpenId Connect Provider entity.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: opid
parameters.description: Identifier of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. Not required when creating an entity, but required when updating an entity.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

clientId.description: Client ID of developer console which is the client application.

clientSecret.description: Client Secret of developer console which is the client application.

description.description: User-friendly description of OpenID Connect Provider.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.
Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes specific OpenID Connect Provider of the API Management service instance.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: opid
parameters.description: Identifier of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: OpenId Connect Provider was successfully deleted.

204.description: OpenId Connect Provider was successfully deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

head.description: Gets the entity state (Etag) version of the openIdConnectProvider specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: opid
parameters.description: Identifier of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Specified openidConnectProvider entity exists and current entity state version is present in the ETag header.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the specific OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.name: opid
parameters.description: Identifier of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

clientId.description: Client ID of developer console which is the client application.

clientSecret.description: Client Secret of developer console which is the client application.

description.description: User-friendly description of OpenID Connect Provider.

properties.description: Parameters supplied to the Update OpenID Connect Provider operation.

schema.description: Parameters supplied to the Update OpenID Connect Provider operation.

204.description: OpenId Connect Provider was successfully updated.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the client secret details of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: opid
parameters.description: Identifier of the OpenID Connect Provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The response body contains the client secret.

schema.description: Client or app secret used in IdentityProviders, Aad, OpenID or OAuth.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
